form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Roberts (for himself, Mr. Thune, and Mr. Johanns) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To improve and extend certain nutrition programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Improve Nutrition Program Integrity and Deficit Reduction Act of 2013.

section.header: Restoring program integrity to categorical eligibility for the supplemental nutrition assistance program

subsection.text: The second sentence of section 5(a) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2014(a)) is amended by striking receives benefits under a State program and inserting receives assistance (as defined in section 260.31 of title 45, Code of Federal Regulations, as in effect on January 1, 2013) under a State program.

Section 5(j) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2014(j)) is amended by striking receives benefits under a State program and inserting receives assistance (as defined in section 260.31 of title 45, Code of Federal Regulations, as in effect on January 1, 2013) under a State program.

section.header: Ending supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits for lottery or gambling winners

subsection.text: Section 6 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Ineligibility for benefits due to receipt of substantial lottery or gambling winnings

paragraph.text: Any household in which a member receives substantial lottery or gambling winnings, as determined by the Secretary, shall lose eligibility for benefits immediately upon receipt of the winnings.

A household described in paragraph (1) shall remain ineligible for participation until the household meets the allowable financial resources and income eligibility requirements under subsections (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (i), (k), (l), (m), and (n) of section 5.

As determined by the Secretary, each State agency, to the maximum extent practicable, shall establish agreements with entities responsible for the regulation or sponsorship of gaming in the State to determine whether individuals participating in the supplemental nutrition assistance program have received substantial lottery or gambling winnings.

section.text: Section 28 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2036a) is repealed.
